eventDecorators.name: OwnershipTransferred
eventDecorators.description: When rewards are claimed by nodes.

eventDecorators.name: Transfer
eventDecorators.description: When rewards are claimed by nodes.

functionDecorators.name: canMint
functionDecorators.description: Returns whether the option ID can be minted. Can return false if the developer wishes to restrict a total supply per option ID (or overall).

functionDecorators.name: isApprovedForAll
functionDecorators.description: Hack to get things to work automatically on OpenSea. Use isApprovedForAll so the frontend doesn't have to worry about different method names.

functionDecorators.name: mint
functionDecorators.description: Mints asset(s) in accordance to a specific address with a particular "option". This should be callable only by the contract owner or the owner's Wyvern Proxy (later universal login will solve this). Options should also be delineated 0 - (numOptions() - 1) for convenient indexing.

parameterDecorators.name: _toAddress
parameterDecorators.description: address of the future owner of the asset(s).

functionDecorators.name: name
functionDecorators.description: Returns the name of this factory.

functionDecorators.name: numOptions
functionDecorators.description: Number of options the factory supports.

functionDecorators.name: owner
functionDecorators.description: Returns the address of the current owner.

functionDecorators.name: ownerOf
functionDecorators.description: Hack to get things to work automatically on OpenSea. Use isApprovedForAll so the frontend doesn't have to worry about different method names.

functionDecorators.name: renounceOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

functionDecorators.name: supportsFactoryInterface
functionDecorators.description: Indicates that this is a factory contract. Ideally would use EIP 165 supportsInterface().

functionDecorators.name: symbol
functionDecorators.description: Returns the symbol for this factory.

functionDecorators.name: tokenURI
functionDecorators.description: Returns a URL specifying some metadata about the option. This metadata can be of the same structure as the ERC721 metadata.

functionDecorators.name: transferFrom
functionDecorators.description: Hack to get things to work automatically on OpenSea. Use transferFrom so the frontend doesn't have to worry about different method names.

functionDecorators.name: transferOwnership
functionDecorators.description: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
